title: Pensive Girl
provenance_text:
Raphael Soyer [1899-1987], New York, NY, until December 1947 [1]; Associated American Artists, Inc., New York, NY [2]; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, April 1948.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 45 (illustrated, plate 13) in "Painting in the United States" held at Carnegie Institute, October-December 1947. 
[2]. As the artist's agent. Offer to sell was accepted by the artist on December 4, 1947 (see copy of correspondence from Pegeen Sullivan of Associated American Artists, dated December 4, 1947.)
[3]. Offer to purchase was approved at the December 3, 1947 meeting of the Fine Arts Committee. The offer was then made and accepted (see not [2] above.) The painting was accessioned at the committee's next meeting on April 23, 1948.

creator.death_place: New York City (New York state, United States)
